title: Comelli 2014 Amplius Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)
description: Delicately scented, this opens with aromas of acacia flower, citrus blossom and orchard fruit. The straightforward palate offers Granny Smith apple, tangerine zest and a touch of mineral while tangy acidity provides balance.

title: Consilience 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Caramelized pear, candied lemon, honeydew melon and a touch of vanilla show on the nose of this rich take on the grape. The palate starts light, with a decent buzz of acidity, before settling into tropical flavors of dried pear and fruit-flavored bubblegum.

title: Danza del Sol 2012 Grenache (Temecula Valley)
description: Dried berries, light licorice, hints of game and a flash of mint show on the nose of this wine from the South Coast. A tangy cranberry-pomegranate-raspberry element shows on the palate, given nuance by an herbal character. It would complement a wide range of meats and cheeses.

title: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2014 Dellago Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Aromas of orchard fruit, nuts and bread crust perfume this Pinot Bianco. The lean palate offers oak, yellow apple skin and a hint of butter alongside brisk acidity.

title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2013 Sanct Valentin Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Oak, yellow apple and butterscotch aromas open on the nose. The structured palate offers toast, mineral, oak-driven spice and a confectionary note but it's shy on fruit richness. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close.

title: Castle Rock 2013 Cuvée Pinot Noir (California)
description: This light but firm style of Pinot shows spicy, slightly herbal and oaky aromas. The palate is fresh and fruit-forward, with a medium body and enough concentration to create a lingering finish.

title: Cembra 2014 Sauvignon (Trentino)
description: Aromas of cut grass, tomato leaf and kiwi lead the way on this vibrant white. The lively palate offers grapefruit, honeydew melon and a tangy note of nectarine zest alongside brisk acidity.

title: Valle 2014 Friulano (Friuli)
description: This straightforward white has subdued scents pear and wildflower. The palate offers mature yellow apple, bitter almond and a hint of candied lemon zest accompanied by brisk acidity.

title: Buena Vista 2013 Attila's Selection Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This is a thick, rich and very ripe wine, with a charred back note making its way against higher-toned tastes of red raspberry and blackberry. The oak is integrated and the wine softly varietal, but it packs a punch on the palate.

title: Airlie 2013 Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: This low-alcohol, off-dry wine offers tart citrus and apple fruit. Light cinnamon accents and significant acidity somewhat offset the 22g/L of residual sugar.

title: Bel Lago 2012 Tempesta Red (Michigan)
description: While no variety is listed on the front label, this is a Cabernet Franc dominant blend. Soft oak tones of sawdust, cherry cola and rooibos are integrated nicely into the red cherry and racy currant fruit characters of this wine. While the concentration is mild, what's there is warm, inviting and and quite drawing.

title: Bel Lago 2013 Pinot Grigio (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: There's a distinct roundness to the palate of this Pinot Grigio, most likely from a bit of sur lie aging. Spiced asian pear and crisp green apple meet preserved lemons on the nose and palate.

title: Blustone 2013 Late Harvest Riesling (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Steely lemon and peach mingle with wildflower honey and pollen aromas. The off-dry palate shows good balance, with juicy red and yellow apples and white flower tones. Flecks of candied lemon mark the finish.

title: Bortoluzzi 2014 Friulano (Collio)
description: Scents of yellow flower, orchard fruit and hazelnut emerge on this lively white. The airy, luminous palate offers up yellow apple skin, green pear and a hint of almond alongside zingy acidity.

title: Brengman Brothers 2013 Estate Grown Crain Hill Vineyards Beerenauslese Riesling (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Done in the German-style of using botrytized grapes, this late harvest Riesling is pale gold in color, with a slight haze. Lemon-peach marmalade aromas linger under a layer of furniture polish. The palate is luscious, with peach-pinapple chutney flavors that lead to a candied-ginger finish.
designation: Estate Grown Crain Hill Vineyards Beerenauslese

title: Monogamy 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: A wine for the faithful, this is tasty and light bodied. It does a nice job of combining fresh, fruity aromas with appealing black-cherry flavors and a moderately tannic, appetizing texture.

title: Sauvion NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: An attractive pale pink wine that has bright red currant fruits, crisp acidity and a lively mousse. It is so fresh, fruity and deliciously crisp and refreshing. The aftertaste is light, bright and full of acidity.

title: Luberri 2014 Orlegi  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery, briny red-berry aromas come with a horsey accent. This is juicy and a bit raw in feel, with slightly tart red-plum and raspberry flavors. A light note of buttery oak on the finish is cut by lasting acidity.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima NV Rosé Bruto Alfrocheiro (Tejo)
description: Better known in the Dão for its red wines, the Alfrocheiro grape can obviously make attractive sparkling wines. This Blanc de Noirs is fresh with just a touch of tannin and full of red currant fruit flavors. Drink now, for its freshness and fruit.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Quartilho Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: From a single vineyard, this wine has structure and dense tannins. It is still young and the lean stalky character needs time to open up. Look for the black currant fruit to become richer over the next year and drink from 2017.

title: Peter Mertes 2014 Platinum Sweet Red Dornfelder (Rheinhessen)
description: Lush and a bit ruddy, this velvety sweet-style Dornfelder bursts of sun-kissed black plums and cherries. It's soft in structure but its fruity, forward demeanor makes for a comforting sip.

title: Petrucco 2014 Pinot Bianco (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Delicate aromas of pressed spring flower, yellow apple and citrus carry over to the brisk palate along with a mineral note. Vibrant acidity gives it a crisp, tangy finish.

title: Geyser Peak 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: A crisp, lively texture makes this medium-bodied wine refreshing while light flavors of green apple and kiwi make it tasty. Vibrant acidity gives it freshness and will help it be versatile with food.

title: Griffin Creek 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rogue Valley)
description: A hard, chewy wine, this brings tight flavors of cassis and black olive, plus an herbal edge that veers into bitterness. Chalky acids come up through an attenuated finish.

title: Hanson Vineyards 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a simple, rather generic white wine. The fruit is clean with an impression of light spice around flavors of apple and pear. It's a useful, all-purpose, fruity quaffer.

title: Kornell 2014 Eich Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Scents of wildflower and apple float out of the glass. The delicate aromas carry over to the light-bodied, linear palate, along with a hint of pear and a mineral accent. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean, fresh finish.

title: La Tunella 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: White flower, orchard fruit and crushed stone aromas delicately guide the nose. The easygoing palate offers Bartlett pear, apple skin and a hint of mineral alongside bright acidity.

title: La Vis 2013 Sette Fontane Nosiola (Trentino)
description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals delicate scents of spring flower and lime. The vibrant, straightforward palate delivers grapefruit and a hint of tangerine accompanied by brisk acidity.

title: Ledger David 2013 Estate Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)
description: At first oaky and tannic, this needs breathing time to show more of its fruit. Red-berry flavors come up slowly, along with lighter notes of herb and stem.

title: Dorigo 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This bright wine has aromas that suggest citrus blossom and tropical fruit. The lively, slender palate shows crunchy Granny Smith apple and pineapple accompanied by brisk acidity.
